website_summaries.verdict: This easy-to-scoop, easy-to-clean cat litter is perfect and convenient for a busy, multi cat home.
pros: The Arm & Hammer litter can be easily discarded, as it is safe to flush down the toilet
Soft clumps are formed quickly and are easy to scoop out
Litter does not stick to the broom, so you can quickly and easily sweep up any messes without tracking litter all over your home
The fresh scent effectively controls any displeasing cat smells
cons: Scent is fresh, but strong and may not appeal to those sensitive to smells

customer_reviews.title: Stinky!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried A&H in the past and it worked well for my cat and me and decided to try this brand. There are many litters that have a strong lingering smell and I thought this one wasn't one of them. I was ever wrong! My cat used it for one day and it was horrible. The whole downstairs level in my home smelled of this litter. IT was bad. It also doesn't clump well, it left behind little clump balls. I am going back to Precious Cat Ultra Premium Clumping Cat Litter, it is the best cat litter on the market!!!
customer_reviews.author: ShoppingNut

customer_reviews.title: WAY TOO PERFUMY!
customer_reviews.text: We have always used the regular A&M Clump & Seal litter, but thought we'd give this new "Platinum" version a try. YUCK! The whole house smells like cat litter, even days after filling our litters with it. I don't want the house to smell like cat waste, but I also don't want it to smell like cat litter either. It is so strong that I almost can't stand to be in the bathroom where we keep one of our litters. We'll be going back to the regular Clump & Seal. It worked fine for our 5 cats without wreaking havoc on my olfactory senses!
customer_reviews.author: waymoo

customer_reviews.title: way too strong perfumed deodorant
customer_reviews.text: the perfumed smell overtook my entire apartment- I very very rarely give negative reviews but this has made my home, my cats and me miserable for last week as I have hoped we could adjust... giving up & donating nearly full container of litter to local rescue where I know they have enough ventilation to handle
customer_reviews.author: Jolee Drake

customer_reviews.title: Formula Change
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this litter (Platinum) for about a year and it was a fine light colored sandy formula which worked great. It clumped well and absorbed all smell for about a month before needed to be changed. Early August 2017 my next ordered came in with slight altered box logo and of course a formula change. It's now a darker with thick grain which barely absorbs any odor. Even fresh from the box it smells off. The original Platinum litter came in a black and purple box.
customer_reviews.author: ZrC

customer_reviews.title: NOT DUST FREE AS IT CLAIMS...YOU WILL USE A LOT OF LITTER BECAUSE IT IS SO FINE THAT IT GETS EVERYWHERE
customer_reviews.text: supposed to be 100% dust free??? WHAT A CROCK. There is an air purifier in that room and within less than 24 hours not only was the front screen dusty, but LITTER WAS ACTUALLY IN THE SCREEN. It is very fine so you will definitely go through way more litter because it adheres tremendously to poop and pee. BUT the claim of dust free is not even true. They have another clumping one my brother got that I put my hand into it and wipe it on my pants and that has no dust, so I have to find out what he bought because THIS IS A BOLD FACE LIE about being dust free, it was not.
customer_reviews.author: wendyk55

customer_reviews.title: Dust free, it really is!
customer_reviews.text: We have an asthmatic cat, so I have tried MANY cat litters in an effort to find one that is truly dust free. This stuff is honestly, really, truly DUST FREE! Our cat’s asthma attacks have decreased drastically since we switched to this litter. It has a pleasant almost citrus smell to it, and the odor control aspect has been pretty great. We have three cats, and we are very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Hawaiian Mom

customer_reviews.title: Not sure about the safety of this stuff
customer_reviews.text: This does everything it says it does...only too well. It clumps very quickly and tightly and it really captures odor very well. However, I have had one very serious issue. Sometimes, my cat steps on a newly formed clump, and it is almost impossible to remove product from her feet afterwards. We have tried soaking her feet in water, but usually we just have to trim her paw hair to get the sand off of her. It’s as if this stuff turns into concrete. It makes me wonder what would happen if she digested any of this substance when she groomed herself. Anyway, I’ve stopped using this stuff and switched back to her old litter.
customer_reviews.author: Soapface

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer Alert
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the most wonderful cat litter ( ugh, am I seriously giddy over cat litter?) I’ve ever tried. My cat is a wonderful little being but by god how are you to deal with the smell? I was seriously worried about moving into my apartment from my family home with significantly more space and better air circulation. Well, through many hours of research I found this to be the one most people gravitate towards. I gave it a shot and it FAR surpassed my expectation. Genuinely leaves my home completely odor free. I saw people express that the formula had changed. I’m unable to comment on that because previously I had used other (subpar) products. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kanace

customer_reviews.title: New Formula? Somewhat Concerning
customer_reviews.text: Did the formula change in the past month? I have been buying this 40-lb multi-cat litter for almost 3 years and the litter I got this month was a much different color (almost all white, compared to the normal gray), SUPER dusty, and smelled different. There was a noticeable difference compared to the litter currently in my box, which was the same litter only purchased last month. I normally LOVE this litter and swear by it, but this box has me a bit concerned. I am curious to see if there are any noticeable differences in the function of the litter.
customer_reviews.author: Eric From KC

customer_reviews.title: Stinks right out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: We're new to cats, so I had no idea what to expect from a litter product. I really like Arm and Hammer products, so this was my first choice. The stench that permeated the litter box area was so bad I had to open windows in winter. Then I had to put an exhaust fan in the area and it's still stink to high heaven. The odor wasn't coming from the cat waste. It was the litter that smelled so bad. It's hard to describe how it smells, but it's a combination of disinfectant, bad air freshener and ammonia. Yes, it stinks of ammonia. Needless to say, we are finishing the box and then never buying this again.
customer_reviews.author: ChristyMc

customer_reviews.title: Best litter I have found...so far.
customer_reviews.text: as long as the litter box is cleaned two or three times daily (we have 2 cats sharing 1 box), this product does a great job of keeping the odors from spreading around the house. The thing I like most about it is it does not seem to get tracked all over the house. We walk around barefoot and it was always uncomfortable to step on granules from our previous kitty litters. This stuff seems to fall off of the cat's paws easier and stays in the litter box instead of all over at the floors of the house.
customer_reviews.author: keenonali

customer_reviews.title: Needs Less Scent Better Odor Control
customer_reviews.text: I have used this litter for a number of years for two different pairs of cats. It definitely clumps well. Tracking and dust acceptable. Cats like it with no issues. My box is in a small laundry room with no vent or window. I find the scent strong and the odor control marginal even though I scoop it 3 times per day. No litter is perfect so reviews will vary. My ideal would be unscented with excellent clumping, odor control and minimal dust and tracking. Haven't found it yet.
customer_reviews.author: G. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Not What It Used To Be
customer_reviews.text: I have had this litter through subscribe and save for the last several months and, until this last month, have been extremely satisfied with it. The number 1 reason I use this litter is because it truly has ZERO dust. I’m not sure if the manufacturer changed the formula or if I got a bad batch. This last box is completely different than the others. The litter grain is much, much larger and it has dust. A lot of dust. I will use it one more month to see if it goes back to its original consistency. If not, I will cancel my order and find something else.
customer_reviews.author: M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Arm & Hammer Platinum Litter
customer_reviews.text: It's great having these heavy boxes delivered to avoid lifting them into a shopping cart, into the trunk, out of the trunk, up the stairs ... Have tried numerous low/no dust litters and so far they're all dusty. This brand is slightly less dusty than others. Tracks, but not as much as other brands. Clumps break apart leaving little pieces that fall through the litter scoop. Average odor control. I scoop numerous times a day. All in all not a bad purchase. Still on the hunt for less dust.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Customer

customer_reviews.title: great if you can figure out how to open the box
customer_reviews.text: I love the product. I had it before and liked it. But opening the box was a trial. I am exhausted from trying. I used a hammer, a screw driver as a punch and a knife and a pliers to help pull. I have a mess and still don't have it completely open. What the heck? Plus it doesn't look like it is filled all the way up. Not sure. Any suggestions on opening this box all the way would be helpful. There was a place that said pull and it didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: patricia george

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the Best Cat Litter...according to my cat
customer_reviews.text: When I started using this I was immediately aware that even a few inches from the litter box there was no smell. It does exactly what it promises, clumps and dumps with no dust or fall out. That's my opinion. But the last word would have to go to my cat who uses it and is in a better position to comment...unfortunately she cannot but I will take her continued usage as a compliment and recommend this on her behalf.
customer_reviews.author: Lew Troop

customer_reviews.title: Really Helps With Ammonia Smells
customer_reviews.text: We had some issues with just using normal clumping, clay litter with Ammonia smells from our 2 cats and figured we'd give this a shot after just adding baking soda alone didn't work. The scent of this litter plus the baking soda really have helped with that ammonia smell a lot and it's significantly less noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Cats Love It
customer_reviews.text: I need a litter that had little tracking, no clouds and kept the smell down because I'm in a tiny condo. My office is actually in the cat litter room. This litter is perfect, does all of the above and more. Cleaning is a breeze because the clumping is immediate. While I'm in here working they use the boxes, but there is absolutely no smell when they are done, the litter has clumped it up and they bury it. I highly recommend this litter.
customer_reviews.author: ladyesmiles

customer_reviews.title: cloud of awful smelling dust
customer_reviews.text: I have been experimenting with different litters and I have gone through 8 types so far. This is by far the worst litter. It smells god awful and there is always a huge plume of dust when our cat goes to use the bathroom. This dust gives me coughing fits and has the worst smelling odor imaginable. Also our cat gets it all over the house and I have to vacuum every time. The absorbency and clumping are great but I’m going back to a non scented non clumping biodegradable litter ( yesterday’s news).
customer_reviews.author: H. Rast

customer_reviews.title: Less dust more traction from paws
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot after using tidy cats regular litter for the past 20 years but the dust was becoming too much for both my allergies and my cat's new allergies. I do love the fact that this does not create dust but it also sticks much more to my cats paws and it is causing little clay clumps around my house. I guess you have to take the good with the bad. I was surprised no one else wrote about this.
customer_reviews.author: Steven K

customer_reviews.title: Best Cat Litter
customer_reviews.text: We have eight cats and need a good litter for them, especially since we do not have the recommended 1 litter box per cat plus one.box and only make due with four. We scoop at least once a day. We have tried lots of other litters. None of them control the smell like Clump and Seal.I used to have to dump all the boxes every two weeks to scrub the smell out of them, but since we switched to this a few months ago, I have emptied and scrubbed the boxes once, just because I felt I should rather than because they needed it.
customer_reviews.author: A Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Zero Odor Control - TERRIBLE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This litter is essentially sand. It is heavy and messy, difficult to lift, hard to empty, turns to even heavier clay when damp, sticks to the box like cement so you have to scrape it off when you empty it to clean it, and worst of all, it has absolutely zero odor control. You may as well have your cat using the living room rug as a cat box. I have gone back to the inexpensive brand in the local grocery store which is easy to lift, easy to clean out, and has great odor control. With this sand my entire house smells every time the cat uses the box. With the store brand I have no odor at all.
customer_reviews.author: P. Feeney

customer_reviews.title: Good price, very heavy, very worth it
customer_reviews.text: It works! I like this one. My one cat isn’t picky so he likes it just fine. It IS finer grained than other litters so if you don’t like that, then yeah not for you I guess? I don’t care really, didn’t see any difference between it and other litters I’ve used in the past. Can’t beat the price. WARNING: I didn’t read the description close enough cause the price was discounted amazing. ITS SO HEAVY. lolol I was like, what is in this package?!?!?! I waited to review now, ordered just before thanksgiving and I’m almost out now and it’s Valentine’s Day. (I’ve only got one cat).
customer_reviews.author: Homeboy Gotcha

customer_reviews.title: Maybe the inexpensive solution to a stank-free living space
customer_reviews.text: One 9 lb female cat who drinks water like a horse and pees like a sprinkler hose. Been through many Purina's Tidy Cats and Arm & Hammer litter and not a single one has kept me from adding baking soda to neutralize the smell after a few days. This mix after 2 weeks has seemed to curtail the issue. Its texture and size is light sandlike, clumps pretty well, and the important--neutralizes that awful cat urine smell as advertised. Liking that it doesn't kick up a dust of 'litter smoke' when poured or scooped, and doesn't stick to the bottom of my cat's paws when she jumps out of the box like a rabbit.
customer_reviews.author: byebyelabs

customer_reviews.title: Best litter ever?
customer_reviews.text: We sure think so! We have 7 cats and this litter is hands down the BEST! It is not always the tightest clumping, but odor capture is stellar, there is zero dust, and it sifts cleanly and easily. The BAD: AMAZON! It's the only place we can find this litter and they ship it loose (or VERY poorly packed) in a large box and the box of litter is often broken and leaking. We are thinking of dropping our auto-ship due to this problem...
customer_reviews.author: AstroFan

customer_reviews.title: Works great with two cats who go a lot
customer_reviews.text: Our cats go a good bit, and they have the smelliest, not solid BMs I've ever experienced in my years of owning cats, but this stuff works amazingly well. For an extra boost we also put in some other stuff, but even on its own its the best litter and nothing else we've bought measures up. Now if we could only figure out how to get them to track less litter everywhere. . .
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha D.

customer_reviews.title: Hard to open box
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I don't like about this is for a woman to try to open this. It's a nightmare. I had to use pliers to get it open. And that was not easy. Took me almost a half an hour. I don't know why they don't make it easier to open. And there's no way I want to be pouring a 40 lb box into my litter box. I don't know what this company is thinking that everyone that buys this is a muscle man.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Litter!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after using PetCo's cheap litter that you can refill the bucket In the store. To preface, I've never had a cat before so I assumed the large mess and bad smell he would make were normal and something you had to learn to live with. ....Then I bought this amazing godsend of litter, and that all changed! It clumps extremely well and absolutely does not let any odor out. It does have a slight fragrance, but it is welcoming to me. The cat seems to like it or at least not mind it, because he still uses the bathroom a ton. Overall, I am very happy and will be using this for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Litter is fine, clumps well, no odors.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had any issues with this litter. I noticed if I scoop too quickly after the cat eliminates the litter might not clump as well. But if you give it 24 hours or so it's fine and solid. I usually scoop every few days so it's nice to just dig in and clean it out. People complaining about the litter not doing its job or has a weird scent? Maybe it's what you feed your cat. I haven't had any issues with this litter and been using it in the last 3+ years. I tried silica, pellets, etc. Much better than anything else you find. It's like sand and my cat likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Z. F.

customer_reviews.title: Really good litter but brace yourself - it's fre**ing heavy
customer_reviews.text: This is some excellent litter. It's too heavy for 110 pound me and my 135 pound husband (11 years older than me) to handle, though. If you don't have a strapping young 16-40 year old in the house, you're going to need a partner to help you haul this around from room to room. My husband and I have it delivered and together we haul it near the cat boxes. Then I saw the top of one litter container open and put a large scoop in it. The heavy box of litter then sits in place until it becomes lighter over the course of the next couple weeks. Part of getting old, I guess. 😲😾
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Best multi-cat litter we've used!
customer_reviews.text: Great litter, we used it with our regular box then segued it to our Litter Robot where it still works awesome for our three cats, much better than any others we've tried! We've been subscribed to the monthly delivery for seven months now which is great as it is super convenient, however it is a very heavy package so sometimes comes damaged as it bops around the shipping box despite the paper packing buffer typically included. Still worth it for me as we park a quarter mile away from our unit and carrying something this heavy that far while managing my kids is a nightmare haha
customer_reviews.author: SPS

customer_reviews.title: Works 100% if scooped daily
customer_reviews.text: The litter has a pleasant smell when new, and with use a neutral smell. It clumps very well and is easy to scoop. It dries rather quickly but not right away. If you scoop the clumps and poo daily a 40lbs now will last you an astonishingly long time. Now if you let it collect and get full most of the litter will become a massive rock. This waste the litter and is a paint to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: So far, I'm not impressed.
customer_reviews.text: I decided to try this instead of the wheat based flushable litter that we have been using because the other stuff got so sticky, it would glue to the bottom of the litter pan. I first poured it in our cats litter pans yesterday and I already can smell pee out of both boxes. I NEVER smelled pee with the last stuff. I'm switching back.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Absorbs scent, then that smell stays forever.
customer_reviews.text: Big fan of A&H baking soda, but their cat litters are a big fail for me. Tried 3 of their formulas/scents. All 3 had the same issue, something in the mix (baking soda i assume) absorbs the cat urine/smelly litter scent. The issue is it keeps that absorbed scent in the litter box, and fills the whole room, and slowly drifts into other rooms. I got so frustrated with the smell, I dumped all of it into a kitchen bag, trashed it and swapes back to another litter. Stinky, lingering, unending smell is now gone.
customer_reviews.author: Patriots fan

customer_reviews.title: The box is unwieldy, litter is fine but slightly scented
customer_reviews.text: This litter works fine, but I won't purchase again. It has a scent, mild but it's there. I only smell it while I'm adding more or scooping, but I don't want scented litter. The bigger problem is the box. It's incredibly awkward at this size and weight. Opening it wasn't fun and pouring it out isn't either. The handle on top is the type that cuts into your hand. I could try to open the top of the box and scoop litter out, similar to the bags I'm used to, but this box is coated cardboard and very thick. I'm going back to the larger, easier, unscented bag of Dr. Elsey's.
customer_reviews.author: Rae Williams

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t block urine smell.. no matter how often you scoop!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using cat litter for 20+ years and I ventured out to try this brand due to quantity, price and Prime... And all seemed well the first three or four days but then I realize no matter how often I scoop the litter and add new litter, that the urine smell was pungent and definitely noticeable. I have always used Fresh Step and will go back to using them.
customer_reviews.author: joshua garbenis

customer_reviews.title: The Best Litter Ever
customer_reviews.text: This litter is the best odor eliminator I've ever found and I've been using it for a couple years now. The absorbency is fantastic, my house never smells like a catbox, and it isn't overly dusty. The one and only downside it has is that it does have a bit of a fragrance of its own. It doesn't smell bad, but it is definitely some kind of perfume/scent that has been added to the litter to boost its odor-killing potency. It isn't especially strong, though. I only really notice it when I'm pouring the litter, it fades pretty quickly after.
customer_reviews.author: Zack Hensley

customer_reviews.title: Do not trust Amazon to keep their word.
customer_reviews.text: Amazon lied. Our Cat little and car food was dumped OUTSIDE the gate of our yard, right by the street.There is NO way for us to move these heavy items, as we are both disabled. I'd like to know who to speak to about this. Then we discovered these idiots dropped one of the boxes and broke it open.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Weddle

customer_reviews.title: This litter sucks!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my litter robot. I was looking for something low dust that clumped hard to cut down on skidmarks in the globe. I previously used Dr. Elsey's Ultra, and most recently Walmart's Special Kitty. Both did great with odor control. I switched out the litter to this one, and within a few hours, my cat room stunk. I have not had this problem since I've had the litter robot. I like the softness of this litter and there was little to no dust, but a litter is useless if it can't control odor. I do not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: crissabear

customer_reviews.title: Awful!
customer_reviews.text: I searched through many litter reviews and decided on this product because so many said this is the best litter ever. I’m so disappointed and quite perplexed!! It smells awful! The chemically perfume was bad enough, but in no time it had my whole room smelling like disgusting cat litter. I thought it would clump for easy cleanup, but it settles in the bottom like thick wet clay. I had to throw all the litter away in order to clean it. It just wouldn’t scoop. It’s also very heavy!! Maybe they’ve changed this product, because I can’t imagine anyone rating it favorably.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey M Wisnewski

customer_reviews.title: IT'S NOT AS ADVERTISED OR PROMOTED
customer_reviews.text: There is not much positive that I can say about this litter. It does not control odor. It is heavy tracking and the animals get it all over the house. It is expensive in comparison for other litters especially since it is advertised to be so good! The one positive to the litter is that it does clump well. If that is all you're looking for then by all means buy the litter but as a pet owner if you are looking for a litter to control the odor, tracking control and pleasant aroma for both you and your animal(s) STAY AWAY from this litter!!!!! I DO NOT RECOMMEND!!! If I could have returned it I would have!
customer_reviews.author: K. A. S.

customer_reviews.title: Cleaning time is much easier now!
customer_reviews.text: Arm and Hammer is my go-to brand for cat litter, so I'm not surprised that this one works good. My cat's "business" is noticeably clumping together better than other series from Arm and Hammer, making the cleaning session a lot easier. 🐈
customer_reviews.author: J.U.

customer_reviews.title: Never again
customer_reviews.text: This does not work for our house, with only 1 cat. The “cat habitat” is in my office, connected to the master bedroom. When the litter is clean, it’s fine. Then once used the smell is strong & very offensive, like chemicals, urine & perfume. And the odor stays even after I scoop, which is at least once a day. It is nearly making me nauseous. -It does clump, at the bottom of the pan, never seems to dry and sticks. -It does track everywhere, which is expected... it is cat litter after all.
customer_reviews.author: DesertJae

customer_reviews.title: This stuff clumps about as perfectly as you could reasonably expect.
customer_reviews.text: Other cat litters I've tried get dark but don't clump when my cats pee and are worthless when they keep peeing in the same spot. This stuff just works. The result is I'm throwing away much less cat litter - I haven't needed to periodically dump any half-used litter - after I scoop I can just add more. Easy. Even though this isn't the cheapest I am convinced that it's saving me money. I rave about this to family & friends because it doesn't make sense to me to use anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Myers

customer_reviews.title: A truly horrendous smell even when frequently cleaned
customer_reviews.text: I’m a new cat owner. I clean my box morning and evening and I dump the whole box weekly. This stuff stinks to high heaven. I’ve never sought a refund for a product like this but Im going to. I can smell it from rooms away. I even sprinkled deodorizer to help out. I have one cat. I switched to a crystal litter with an electric litter box. So far zero smell. I had to stick a fan in the window backwards to pull out the initial smell this litter left. I saw that it came highly recommended. I would NEVER purchase or recommend this product again. Fingers crossed the crystal litter does much better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 4 month old kittens that are 8 pounds each! I have one litter box in my bedroom for them and that’s it. I change it every other day and there’s no smell. None at all and I have a very sensitive nose. So sensitive that I cannot even be in a restaurant that is cooking much seafood. There is no smell!!️ I couldn’t believe it! The other stuff that I was using was more expensive and I had to clean it every day and it stunk.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey M. Packer

customer_reviews.title: Item broken in box, litter everywhere but in the product box
customer_reviews.text: I use this cat litter regularly, in fact I have automated to send each month. This recent one, I opened the box it came in and the part of the litter carton was perfectly opened (as if someone did it themselves). Now I have a box filled with all the litter in it. I live in a humid area; the time from delivery to me getting home from work, most of the litter was in clumps! Do NOT purchase from this third party! Arm & Hammer, you need to disconnect your product from this full filler; I’m 100% certain I’m not the only one this has happened to.
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia Beaverhausen

customer_reviews.title: Does not do what you want it to do!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the new “platinum” version is nowhere near as good as the regular version of this litter which amazon doesn’t carry. The litter only stays odor free for a few days and then it smells horrible. It doesn’t clump hard enough so when I scoop they disintegrate into tiny clumps I can’t get out. The litter must be lighter because it gets stuck in the cats’ paws and tracks all over the house and furniture. The only good thing about this litter is that it’s dust free.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Many batches are bad these days
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered this monthly for the last 2 years. Most of the boxes used to be good. The odor elimination worked for longer than the other brands i've found. However, now, every other box seems bad. It smells worse, is much darker in color, and hardly eliminates any odors. I'm giving 2 stars instead of 4-5 because of this. In fact, I used to get this every month, and I’m not going to take the risk anymore. I’m starting the search for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: daniel rachman

customer_reviews.title: No More Odor!
customer_reviews.text: I'd love to go all natural but I've tried them all and I have to be able to breath clean air. This product is low dust, so that's good for my kitties and it's amazing at keeping odor at bay. I went thru more high end litter than you can imagine before finding this. Nothing else held a candle to it's odor control ability. It's also soft on my cats paws. So soft that the first thing my cat did was LAY DOWN IN IT! No worries tho, he knew instantly what it was for and I'm a happy cat lady. You'll need three men and a boy to lug the larger size box in tho. It weighs a ton.
customer_reviews.author: Patty Piazza

customer_reviews.title: Who loves to clean the litter box now? Me
customer_reviews.text: OMG. Who knew I'd be checking the litter box to see if there's anything to clean?! Until this litter, urine balls would just crumble before they left the litter box. It stunk! This litter is the best ever. After dumping the old litter and washing the litter box, this litter clumps every urine ball nice and hard and nothing crumbles. The cat's room smells good! It's just so exciting that I am happy to clean the litter box. It is expensive, so I hope it lasts a long time 😁
customer_reviews.author: BorNaSuSa

customer_reviews.title: A 40 lb box is pretty hard to lift to pour by the handle on ...
customer_reviews.text: My cats prefer this litter over other brands as well as the lighter weight one from Arm & Hammer. The only issue I have is that everyone in the house agrees that the company needs to add another strap on the side of the box so that it is easier to lift. A 40 lb box is pretty hard to lift to pour by the handle on the top. A handle on the side would make it MUCH easier to pour. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: hfhjc

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for Small space odor elimination
customer_reviews.text: We have been living in a very small space and much to my dismay, have to have the litter in my bedroom in an open space (not a closet). Whenever anyone visits I ask them to be very honest if there is a scent, (other than if the kitty has Just used the litter), and so far the answer has been that they were shocked there was a kitty litter right there. We have been using this litter for a year now and I believe that it is worth the investment to try, especially if you are in a small space. I recommend this any chance I get!!
customer_reviews.author: David K

customer_reviews.title: Been using this product for years, but....so expensive now.
customer_reviews.text: It seems as though it's not clumping as well as it used to for cat urine. It's also much more dusty than when I first used it, so when I'm swapping out litter, there's whole dust plumes up in the air. However, it is fairly convenient to be subscribed to it so they bring it straight to my door, so I can avoid lugging it up stairs or from the store. The price is absolutely horrid though, as it's much much cheaper buying from any physical store.
customer_reviews.author: Sammi Vuong

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous but not dust free
customer_reviews.text: Definitely love this litter. Smells good (almost Banana/Fresh smell) and clumps super well. I’m not quite sure why everyone says this is dust free, I get a big plume of dust when I scoop the box. My kittens also track it quite a bit. I definitely love this litter because it leaves my house smelling like nothing at all! We do regularly scoop twice a day, so we are definitely religious about keeping things sanitary! If you don’t want to smell your cats waste, this is highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. does as advertised. I do however have one complaint. the shipping this time was terrible .The outside packaging was way too large and had obviously broken apart in transit and been re-taped. The inside contained 2 items one being the litter. The liter box had been broken open and re-taped . There was litter spilled all over under the tape and was quite a mess. I've never had problems like this before, and hope not to have them again
customer_reviews.author: sara

customer_reviews.title: Superior odor control
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 kittens at home. One always has very loose poop and sometimes doesn’t bury her poop completely. I found with other similar products it wouldn’t get rid of the smells. With this product I can virtually stand right on top of it and smell nothing! It also has very good clumping. Highly recommend. Plus with 40lbs it lasts longer than smaller packages. For 2 kittens we have 3 litter disposable boxes. This litter extends the usage for us.
customer_reviews.author: Fivestarmama84

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't track as much as other litters
customer_reviews.text: This is the best litter I have tried for my cat. It doesn't track as much as others and clumping factor and odor elimination is the best out of all the litters I have tried. I'm sticking for it for now. It doesn't eliminate all odors like it says. It also doesn't clump as much as it says, but it works. Update 8/12/2020: why does the litter look completely different than the last 3 boxes I’ve gotten? It’s not covering more area than the last one did.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Just plain Great!
customer_reviews.text: We have had our cat for one month! First used regular Arm and Hammer Slide, it was okay, but had a slight unpleasant odor. Then we tried a cheaper “off” brand, it worked well with very low odor, but it had black specs that stained the floor. Then I went to Amazon and ordered Arm and Hammer Clump and Seal...no odor, the cat loves it, no black specs. We’ve signed up for auto delivery and everyone including the cat are happy and NO odor.
customer_reviews.author: CAM

customer_reviews.title: So Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Why does the "Platinum" version of this perfect litter suddenly ruin a perfect litter!!! We had the 38 pound box subscribed and saved, and our cat loved it, we loved it, everyone was happy. Then they no longer carried that size in subscribe and save, so they automatically swapped us to the "Platinum." We figured no big deal... But oh man!!! Not good! The Platinum has this strong chemical lemon smell. It is nauseating, and you are reminded of that scent every time our can jumps into the box. So disappointed with this. I wish they didn't touch the formula. Now I have to figure out where I can get the old stuff...
customer_reviews.author: Savannah

customer_reviews.title: AWFUL SMELL!
customer_reviews.text: I usually use walnut based litter but Amazon did not have it available so we had to order this. LET ME TELL YOU this smell is HORRENDOUS! Yea, it doesn't smell like cat S*** but it has a certain odor. My husband and I both gag at it. I usually have a pretty strong stomach but just the smell of this when I go to change the litter activates my gag reflex and sends a wave of nauseous throughout my whole body. SO horrible! I would not recommend buying this at all and I will NOT be ordering again!
customer_reviews.author: Isabel Arnold

customer_reviews.title: The best there is
customer_reviews.text: We have tried a whole lot of litter out there on the market, and for us (4 cats, 4 top-entry litter boxes) this has been the best. It clumps hard as a rock, it does a great job with limiting odors, and it is “relatively” dust free. I should note that I am of the opinion that no cat litter is truly dust free, and the real key to limiting odor is cleaning the boxes everyday (Litter Genie is good). Every now and again something goes on big sale and I will stray away, but this has always been what we go back to.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Green

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: 1. This smells awful 2. Instead of masking it adds to the odor 3. It’s super dusty 4. The litter odor stays on the cats
customer_reviews.author: Donna P

customer_reviews.title: Easy clean up and covers up smell!
customer_reviews.text: I switched to arm & hammer litter and it’s SO MUCH BETTER! I find that these smaller crystals don’t get all over the place as much. They also clump around pee a lot easier so that when you’re scooping the pee doesn’t break into tiny pieces. It 100% covers the smell also- everyone I have over my apartment says they can’t even tell I have a cat!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Maroon

customer_reviews.title: Almost dust free, and great clumping, not 7 day odor control
customer_reviews.text: This is almost completely dust free, which is what I was looking for. Clumps very nicely. We have a Litter Robot, clumping litter is a necessity, but after four days, I am smelling the cat box. We change the bag weekly, sometimes more, but I am seeing that we are having to replace the disposal bag every four days to keep the smell at Bay. Not too sure about odor control for 7 days. I have not experienced that. Wish I could find odor control and dust free litter ....
customer_reviews.author: Chris Beckemeyer

customer_reviews.title: The worst litter imaginable.
customer_reviews.text: This litter does what none other ever has, cat urine produces a mushy puddle that sticks to the cats feet. Three times in three days the cat took wiz and came out with big clumps stuck to one foot which she shook across the room. And that mess was sticky. I made the mistake (only once) of trying to pick it up with my vacuum and it smeared across the tile floor. Fortunately we don't have carpeting.
customer_reviews.author: KurtSlo

customer_reviews.title: This litter is relatively fine, almost like sand in terms of texture and ...
customer_reviews.text: This litter is relatively fine, almost like sand in terms of texture and particle size. This stuff works extremely well on the smell front. It clumps well, almost too well, you will go through it quickly because it clumps like mad. The downside to it is that it is like the glitter of the cat litter world - this stuff. Gets. EVERYWHERE. My cat has pretty dense long fur so she tracks just a bit. This stuff goes with her, everywhere. You NEED a litter catching mat with this stuff if you don't want to go broom and vacuum crazy. I'd love to use something else for this reason but haven't found the right litter yet.
customer_reviews.author: SRD

customer_reviews.title: Works great in automatic cat litter system
customer_reviews.text: This product was recommended as an effective, yet less costly cat litter to use vs. the crystals. I used the crystals that came with the automatic cat litter box, but my older female cat didn't really like them. This product is more like regular cat litter, but is finer grain so the rakes in the automatic cleaning tray don't get clogged. The litter overs everything so it can be pushed by the rakes into the litter holding tray and rakes the litter back in an even layer ready for the next use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Zero Dust? Yeah right
customer_reviews.text: This produces more dust than "The Worlds Greatest Cat Litter" which is 99% dust free. This stuff also is weidly... wetish? Heavy? Just feels odd so it sticks to my cats paws and they even ingest it a bit. I bought this for the "Zero Dust" because of my special needs cat with respiratory problems and now i need to go pay for an 800 dollar nasal flush to get him back to being okay. I guess this is my fault for not checking on how much dust it produced until I noticed the problem with my cat, but seriously guys, don't market something with words that can be potentially life threatening for our furrbabies.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfenacht

customer_reviews.title: Hands down...THE PERFECT LITTER!  Easy Clean Up!  Long Lasting!  Not overpowering Smell! No Dust!
customer_reviews.text: ok....I have 2 full time indoor cats. I am a stickler for smells. I have literally tried it seems a gazillion litters! Nothings worked to MY satisfaction....or if it did...not but a day or 2. I have a very sensitive nose!! YALL....this is the PERFECT litter!! Finally!! So I felt inclined to REALLY brag on this! PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE DO NOT STOP making this!!!!!!!!!!!!!! =) Clean up...easy! No smells...no dust! And it lasts sooo much longer! and I am VERY picky! THIS IS IT!!! Hands down! I get scared saying it....when I finally find THE perfect product of any kind....they stop making it. But this has been a HUGE life saver for me! =)
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly McLeod

customer_reviews.title: The BEST Cat Litter
customer_reviews.text: First time cat owner. So many cat litter options. I learned that you def want a "dust free" product plus one that absorbs and eliminates odors very well. The smell of cat poop is by far stronger than my dogs. It made me gag the first time I cleaned the litter box. I can now confidently clean my cat's litter box without smelling anything. This stuff has earned a permanent place in my home.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca M.

customer_reviews.title: Easily the best litter I've used in an auto litter box.
customer_reviews.text: We have a littermaid box and it requires hard clumping litter to function correctly. This litter clumps quickly and works perfectly for the scooper to rake it out. The odor control is unbelievable. Our box is inside a litter box cabinet in our living area and we never smell stray odors. Vacuums up easily. Ive tried a few different hard clump litters and this is the one I'll be purchasing from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Chat Myers

customer_reviews.title: No dust, odor almost non existant, lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.text: I tried many brands over the years. Finally I bought a small box at a local store. The first thing I noticed was the lack of dust. Since the litter box was located close to where I exercise that was a big deal. Shortly I noticed that it had little odor. Then I saw this on Amazon so I bought the 40 pound box and replaced all litter at once. No odor, no dust, and easy to clean. Just ordered 80 pounds so I am set for a while. This is now the only litter I will use. My basement is now useable for other puposes. Thank You A&H.
customer_reviews.author: DaveK

customer_reviews.title: Extremely High Absorbency
customer_reviews.text: Takes a while for the odor to be eliminated but, once eliminated, stays eliminated. Almost over-absorbs urine into very large clumps —the box will not last as long as I anticipated. Extremely heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Katz

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to open
customer_reviews.text: Its dust free and does a good job absorbing odor. Good for a multi cat house. Major down side is the box is very heavy and whoever designed the box itself should be fired...its a huge struggle just to get the box open.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy campbell

customer_reviews.title: Different every time
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this litter for well over a year now and for some reason every time I order I get something different. Sometimes the litter is lighter colored and fresh scented and others I get a batch that is a lot darker and has a sickly sweet funk to it that smells up all of the surrounding rooms. It is awful. It is honestly like two totally different products and I don’t understand why.
customer_reviews.author: hailey browning

customer_reviews.title: Who knew I could loved litter?!?
customer_reviews.text: I thought litter was litter. I used to purchase the bulk litter from the local national pet store chain. The issue was that it was tremendously dusty. So much so, my entire basement smelled like litter. It was terrible, but I didn't notice it much. Imagine my surprise when I purchased a box of this on a whim and found that it smelled nice and, best of all, it had zero dust. The clumps are hard and don't fall apart. Easy to clean up. It's great!!!
customer_reviews.author: T. Person

customer_reviews.title: BEST. LITTER. EVER. Use the other stuff for oil dry!
customer_reviews.text: Clumps SOLIDLY no matter how a p1ss biscuit my litter critter leaves in the box. Little guy can't talk to me but I'm pretty sure he likes the fact that ALL the litter gets removed because this stuff works so well. P1ss biscuits or poo patties, this brand is THE cat's meow. Buy this and use the other junk for oil dry, automobile fluid clean-up.
customer_reviews.author: Einjerhar

customer_reviews.title: SmellsBadMan
customer_reviews.text: This is quite possibly the worst smelling cat litter I have ever encountered, worse than the cheapest dollar store stuff. I tried it because Amazon listed it as recommended, but HOO WEE save yourself the trouble of trying it unless you are aiming for a crazy cat lady aestetic because this stuff really amplifies the smells of the litterbox if anything. Maybe it's the taxoplasmosis in cat hoarers driving people to perpetuate this foul product. It works great as a litter, but it smells absolutely dreadful. TL;DR - it works but it smells atrocious.
customer_reviews.author: dandychained

customer_reviews.title: Solid litter, could improve better in urine clumping and a formation that stays off of cats
customer_reviews.text: It worked well for a long time, better than most litters. However, of late we started seeing caked-on littler on his paws and hind legs. Either the formation has changed or he has not adapted well as he has gotten older. It was good while it lasted, but we will be trying out new litter for a better fit. Odor neutralization is better than average and so is clumping, but if your cat urinates a lot, it tends to not absorb as well into a bit of a muddy mess. Feels like it worked better in the past but this is just my anecdotal experiences.
customer_reviews.author: Trump’s an Idiot

customer_reviews.title: Best litter I’ve ever used
customer_reviews.text: I almost never write reviews, but I was sick this week and didn’t change the litter for a couple of days for my three cats and this is amazing! It doesn’t break apart on the urine chunks by the sides of the box and doesn’t stink (except for the actual litter smell which isn’t horrible). I’ll gladly spend the extra money for this!
customer_reviews.author: Keisha

customer_reviews.title: Much more pleasant smell and it keeps odors at bay
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats and I thought it would be impossible to keep the smell of the litter box at bay, but I was wrong. I was skeptical on trying this litter but after reading the reviews and being fed up with the smell, I decided to try it. It works WONDERS. I can barely smell the litter and even when I do, it’s not a cat pee/feces smell. It gives off a much more pleasant smell. I switched from Dr. Elsey litter and I don’t think I’m going back. I’m going on day 3 without changing the litter (by accident of course due to such a busy schedule) and it still doesn’t smell bad.
customer_reviews.author: Sonya

customer_reviews.title: We Like It.
customer_reviews.text: So far I like it A LOT better than any other litter we have used. No overbearing perfume smell. I gave 4 stars because it really needs to come in 2 20lb boxes. If you buy this litter and you're planning to pour it straight from the box, you had better be prepared to lift all 40lbs of it. We have a top entry litter box. So, that was fun. :/ If you can't lift 40lb you could always scoop it in I guess. But you'll need to make a plan to get it in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Used to be better than the store product
customer_reviews.text: A few months ago, this product nearly doubled in price and the product itself changed, it's not worth the extra $15 dollars, just hit up a walmart and get the non-platinum version, tis the same now.
customer_reviews.author: haha

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as promised
customer_reviews.text: This is the best cat litter. It smells fresh (to me a little like bananas, but nobody else seems to get that) but it most DEFINITELY masks the poop smell in the litter box. With a cheap brand of litter I was frequently nauseated in my own home because I could smell exactly what was in the litter box straight after walking in the door. I had to clean it out every single day to try to control the smell. After switching to this one, I had no further problems.
customer_reviews.author: Blue

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra money!!
customer_reviews.text: We've tried so many litters, and I was unhappy with the overwhelming smell every time I walked into my laundry room. We own a covered dome box with air filter and sift it every day, and it still smelled. This litter is more like large-grain sand. My cat seems to like it much better. We've also noticed the litter doesn't get all over the room because it doesn't stick to the cats paws like the other types of litter, and we own a litter catcher mat which now works the way it is supposed to. This litter is worth the extra money!
customer_reviews.author: MellenDiamond

customer_reviews.title: Rather Stick With Target Brand
customer_reviews.text: This is not my favorite litter or something I will come back to. The smell is too potent and it doesn’t seem as though it works well with either feces (1 or 2) a cat makes. It does not clean well when I go to scoop the box clean; especially when it comes to urine. The litter clumps too easily and almost seems like cookie dough, where it sticks to everything but is not easy to clean. It does not cover stool very well either so more often than not I’m walking into a room that smells. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: This is the best cat litter formula that I have come across. I do not smell a thing when my little kitty uses the bathroom. I used several other brands before purchasing this after reading the reviews and it's 100% better than the others that I tried. It is also very fine and everything absorbs right into it for easy removal. I will never purchase anything else.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: The odor control and clumping has been getting worse for me lately. I don’t know if they changed something or what. Also, which is not the product itself but the delivery. Stop sending these 40 lb boxes with other items. Half the time it crushes the other products and the other half of the time the litter itself is busted and leaking. This time, lucky me, I get both. So decide if you want busted products and/or litter before ordering.
customer_reviews.author: debenbrie

customer_reviews.title: NOT DUST FREE AS ADVERTISED  !!!
customer_reviews.text: I encluded pictures of my massage chair that is totally ruined from the dust that got into the motor!!! This is supposed to be 100% DUST FREE!!! The fist order was completly dust free! How was I to know the next 4 boxes were full of dust!!! So dusty it got all the way up to my window still.... On my oil lamps!!!! Don't trust lighting them now!!! Stopped buying TIDY CAT for the same reason! FRAUD!!!😾😬😧
customer_reviews.author: Curious714

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t like scent or performance
customer_reviews.text: I used this litter for about two months, and realized I just don’t like it so I switched back to Tidy Cat unscented. The product is marketed as zero-dust, odor-reducing, and good clump/clean. It has a sort of perfume-y scent that grossed me out a little. I also found that the product after use by the kitties almost got a little muddy and would settle on the bottom of the litter tray, making it a real pain to clean up. I ended up having to soak the litter box outdoors and scrub it every timed I changed the litter.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey D

customer_reviews.title: No odor control by day 3 with frequent scooping
customer_reviews.text: We purchased us to welcome our 10 week old kitten home. By day 2 the urine smell was very apparent so I changed out the litter I continued scooping every single day, sometimes twice a day, but the litter did not last more than 2 or 3 days before the whole room smelled of urine. I wouldn't recommend this product. It did clump well, so I'm not sure what the issue is.
customer_reviews.author: Quirkymama23

customer_reviews.title: This has been the best litter for our 2 in door cats
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with this litter. Great absorption and odor control. I clean the box once a day, but sometimes I miss a day and this has held up and is the only brand I am currently buying. I tried a few others from Costco and Sams. Different brands, but hey buy in bulk and save right? Well I ended up returning both as they were not up to the task even with once a day cleanings and went right back to this brand. Solid buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B

customer_reviews.title: Worth putting on subscribe and save
customer_reviews.text: After trying several brands of cat litter, this is the only one we buy anymore. It clumps far better than the two or three other brands we tried, and costs less. I really love having it delivered right to my door, because it saves me from forgetting to buy it, and I don't have to drag a heavy box in from the car.
customer_reviews.author: Christina MartinTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: The Best Litter Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Having cats in our home for 35 years means we've tried just about every litter option available. Since we can't tolerate fragrances, and many companies think perfume is good enough to mask odors, we're always looking for effective unscented products, which is how we found Clump and Seal. We quickly realized that this is the best litter ever. Odors have disappeared. This litter, along with the litter genie, means we no longer worry about maintaining a fresh smelling home.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: It was ok but still had an odor. Our lives have changed for the better, we joined Kitty Poo Club. Disposable, once a month litter box with semi hood. Silica litter. Oh my Gosh! The Best! Monthly delivered to your door and you dispose of the original litter and box and start fresh, around $20 per month. Worth it to us not to have that odor.
customer_reviews.author: marwitt

customer_reviews.title: Does a decent job with 3 cats
customer_reviews.text: Does a decent job of getting rid of cat odor from the litter box room. The urine always clumps and is easy to get out. As long as you empty the litter consistently, the litter keeps working for a week or so before you have to put more in(if that makes sense because of the odor). It doesn't smell bad when I pour it into the cat boxes and I don't usually have too much litter residue floating around in the area afterward. All and all I would say it is one of the better ones I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if there's anything better
customer_reviews.text: The product does ok at covering the scent but I feel it dusts a little bit (mainly notice it after cleaning the litter box when the smell wafts in the air a bit). Also, idk if this is for this litter or all but the clumps from my cat's pee usually end up pretty damn big. My last box came leaking litter but Amazon did a great job of replacing it for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Showalter

customer_reviews.title: Best one we have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: For us this ahs been the best so far for our three cats. Clumps just right. Not dust free, but pretty darn good. We tried more expensive, less expensive, other types from this brand...and this has won them all out. Does not mask the powerful poops. Does not have a strong chemical or deodorant smell that cats hate or makes the poop smell even worse. I forget what one we had that our kids could not change because it hurt their eyes. I hope they do not change the formula on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Angela & Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the home odor free
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd brand of litter we’ve tried for our cats’ shared litter box. It beats the others, no contest. You don’t notice any smell at all until you are right in front of it. Our kiddo no longer pitches a fit when it’s his turn to scoop the box. One box lasts 3-4 weeks if, as per the instructions, you gradually add more to the litter tray as you scoop throughout the week.
customer_reviews.author: DrB99
